reviews.text: This hotel is extremely beautiful, beautiful grounds, beautiful rooms, but is definitely lacking in some areas. We were extremely disappointed in the beach. The beach was extremely rocky and looked terrible. I did get some great pictures of the sunset coming down over the mountains however. There isn't a restaurant on site (I think they are building it) so we had to go out and eat or cook in our rooms every night. One night the lights even went out but it was fixed in less than an hour. We got a good laugh about it. The rooms were beautiful. We had a 2 bedroom suite and it was extremely nice. The beds were not that comfortable. I think I would have rather stayed on the couch. The king sized bed was 2 twins pushed together. So at one point in the middle of the night, my fiance woke up because he felt the beds coming apart. Overall, I think this hotel was nice very pretty but very average right now. I think it has the opportunity to one day be a great hotel. There's quite a bit of construction so obviously they are trying to make improvements.
reviews.title: Nice but a little disappointed

reviews.text: Typical Marriott timeshare set up with 2 bedrooms, 2 baths, kitchen. beautiful Spanish decor, all rooms have balcony overlooking ocean. Felt totally safe, locked gate to private beach, underground parking (very tight get a small car). Personal very helpful, concierge to plan excursions. Restuarant on site- so-so and expensive. Flamenco show on Thursday expensive but worth it, Supermarket 5 minute drive-small more expensive shop on site that does make wonderful breads every morning. car a must to drive to nearby towns. You are 10 minutes outside village of Estepona, 10 minute drive to Puerto Banus, 1 hour to Gilbratar and Malaga.
reviews.title: perfect hotel for exploring southern spain

reviews.text: Trip to Morocco was fantastic- do NOT ask price on anything or you will be hounded unmercifully by salesmen. Walk in market overwhelming by merchants. If you buy barter, T-shirt started at 15 Euros and finally came down to ONE. Don't change your money they take anything over there. Fast ferry from Tariffa was pleasant, you definately want to book a tour- would get lost or miss too much. We booked bus tour from hotel because of tanker strike and no gas, but others drove and said easy to find and park at ferry.
reviews.title: Resort Yes, Timeshare No!

likes.liked: — Five star bedroom accommodation and bathroom facilities,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Took toll road from airport in malaga-well maintained and easy drive. Driving in Spain is an adventure. Need to get used to turn arounds (you can only turn right onto roads so must pass your destination get off and use roundabout to get on in opposite direction- these are well marked centrio de cambio). Driving thru town and in large cities -look out. Spanish drivers zip in and out, honk and yell a lot. Parking very tight.
reviews.title: Great Place with excellent service

reviews.text: All in all a wonderful vacation- many options for day trips, but plan on a few down days so can enjoy the beautiful setting at playa andaluza. Don't miss trip to Granada/Alhambra- highlight of our trip, but a very long day if you do bus tour-add 2 hours just for picking up and dropping off people!
reviews.title: Wonderful Resort

likes.liked: — The interior and exterior of the resort were very well kept; Location on the Mediterranean

reviews.text: We have stayed at both Marriot's in Costa del Sol. As noted prior the beach is all rocky, but easily accessible and closer to the resort.
reviews.title: American Standards

likes.disliked: — the beach and price of food

reviews.text: Estepona-
reviews.title: Had a marvellous time

likes.disliked: — No wireless internet, hot water in shower took a long time to come

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: good restuarants across the road. Same set-up as Marbella, but much further away from the favorite villages of Nerja and Mijas.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel for exploring southern Spain, but avoid Africa tour!

reviews.text: Both restuarants way over price- as expected.
reviews.title: Great Apartment / Terrible Service at Restaurant & Bar

likes.liked: — The size of the 2 bedroom apartment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I really liked the lounge chairs at the adult pool- great view!
reviews.title: Good, but some reservations - certainly not 5*
Love it time and time again!
reviews.text: I go here twice a year and cannot recommend it highly enough, never overcrowded, great staff, gorgeous roms and great amenities including gym, shop and restaurants. definitley worth its 5* rating!! Good luck getting booked in though!

We visited Marriott Playa Andaluza as part of a 'cheapie' preview package organised by American Airlines. It is a lovely resort with excellent facilities and beautifully furnished and luxurious apartments. My only criticism would be that the outdoor pool was closed for the winter even though the temperature was about 20 degrees. There is a nice indoor pool but the water is so warm it's like getting into somebody else's bath water.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, terrible location

likes.liked: — Quality of the apartments and facilities

reviews.text: The resort is in a really terrible area, surrounded by tacky golf and retirement complexes and huge numbers of dusty construction projects. The inhabitants of this coast seem to be aging British lager louts who spend most of their time shouting into their mobile phones. There are no decent restaurants or bars within walking distance.
reviews.title: Nice resort - very small studio

reviews.text: We attended the vacation club sales presentation and, unlike one previous contributer, I did find this rather aggressive and unpleasant although there was no real pressure put on you to buy. One thing that did strike me as odd is that the vacation club seems to be run by a company called Interval Travel and not Marriott which was not made clear at the beginning.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Marriott's Playa Andalusia and restaurant tips
reviews.text: We traded to go this Marriott through Interval - we've stayed at many of the MVC resorts and are used to their high level of standards. We have also stayed at the Marbella vacation club - and of the two this is the nicer resort. The beach area and amenities are nicer here than in Marbella. Our biggest complaint with the Playa Andaluza is the size of the studio unit. We have stayed in several studio units, since it is just myself and my husband, but this is by the far the smallest - smaller than most hotel rooms we've stayed in. There was only room for the bed, a small table and two chairs, and some built in storage. There is a small refrigerator, sink, and microwave.

I travelled out to the playa andaluza as a preview package with the marriott hotels, like someone else mentioned above. i know the marriott hotels, so i was expecting a very high standard from the resort, but it exceeded my expectation! everything, from the service to the location, to the facilities was top of the range! i travelled with my husband and our two girls (5 and 8). the girls had an absolute ball, there is a free kiddies club at the resort where the girls made plenty of friends and played games etc.
reviews.title: super for short getaways!

reviews.text: we booked the package after my husband received a call from the marriott. we were sceptable at the beginning, initially because we didn't quite believe that they were the marriott, and then because we were told that it was mandatory to attend a 90min sales presentation. as you can imagine, alarm bells started ringing!!!!!!! we were assured that the marriott do not believe in hard sales, and it was more so to increase awareness of their "vacation club" than to sell to us, but we decided that the price was so good that we would chance it.
reviews.title: Wondeful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we needn't have worried. the 90min presentation flew, and it was actually quite interesting!! we told them from the start that we were most definitely not interested in purchasing or joining anything, and they respected our position, and we just really had a chat!
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL RESORT - deserves five star !

likes.liked: — The resort was beautifully set amongst grounds overlooking the ocean.

reviews.text: the resort is located on the beach, so we spent a lot of our time there, and eating at the resort restaurant (absolutely gorgeous food!!!!). there was construction going on while we were there, but it didnt really affect me, although my husband was a bit peeved off.
reviews.title: usual marriots high standards

reviews.text: overall, we had a fantastic break, as myself and my husband got to spend a lot of time together while we knew the girls were being well looked after and were enjoying themselves (we even had two evenings to ourselves as the resort has a babysitting service!!).
reviews.title: Great Guest Service

likes.liked: — The Pool, the Staff, the easy access to area sites
